Read a VCF file.

Read a VCF file.

read_vcf(vcf)

Arguments

vcf

vcf filename

Value

data_frame

Note

return value has chrom, start and end columns. Interval lengths are the size of the 'REF' field.

See also

Other read functions: read_bed, read_genome

Examples

vcf_file <- valr_example('test.vcf.gz')
read_vcf(vcf_file)
#> # A tibble: 11 x 18
#>    CHROM   POS      ID   REF   ALT  QUAL FILTER                         INFO
#>    <chr> <int>   <chr> <chr> <chr> <int>  <chr>                        <chr>
#>  1     1    10    1:10     A     T   100   PASS  NS=5;AC=0;AN=10;AF=0.000000
#>  2     1    20    1:20     G     C   100   PASS               NS=0;AC=0;AN=0
#>  3     1    30    1:30     C     A   100   PASS  NS=6;AC=0;AN=12;AF=0.000000
#>  4     1    40    1:40     A     C   100   PASS  NS=6;AC=0;AN=12;AF=0.000000
#>  5     1 10000 1:10000     G     C   100   PASS  NS=6;AC=0;AN=12;AF=0.000000
#>  6     1 20000 1:20000     T     A   100   PASS NS=6;AC=12;AN=12;AF=1.000000
#>  7     4  5000  4:5000     A     T   100   PASS NS=6;AC=12;AN=12;AF=1.000000
#>  8     4  6000  4:6000     C     T   100   PASS NS=6;AC=11;AN=12;AF=0.916667
#>  9     X   800   X:800     A     C   100   PASS NS=6;AC=12;AN=12;AF=1.000000
#> 10     X   900   X:900     A     T   100   PASS NS=6;AC=12;AN=12;AF=1.000000
#> 11     X  1000  X:1000     T     G   100   PASS NS=5;AC=10;AN=10;AF=1.000000
#> # ... with 10 more variables: FORMAT <chr>, X1 <chr>, X2 <chr>, X3 <chr>,
#> #   X4 <chr>, X5 <chr>, X6 <chr>, chrom <chr>, start <int>, end <int>
